chunks.en: A review of nearly a year of unemployment (see how I saved myself)
It's been almost a year since I became unemployed.
My last job officially ended on March 15, 2024, and since then, I have been in a "free developer" state.
I tried to find a job during that time, but there weren't many positions I could apply for. I only interviewed at one company, but it didn't work out.

So, starting in July, I devoted myself to independent development with high intensity. As long as the library was open (closed on Mondays), I would spend almost the whole day there, and sometimes continue working until midnight after returning to my room.

chunks.en: My main focus is the crypto space, mainly doing airdrop farming and arbitrage (I was waiting for the zkSync results in June, but it was not ideal, so I officially started independent development in July).

chunks.en:
ğŸ’° Timeline of turning income positive:
âœ… October 2024: Initial public offering script (Sui chain meme IPO) began to generate income.
âœ… December 2024: Arbitrage (Solana chain arbitrage between various DEXs) began to generate income.
âœ… December 2024: Someone on X proactively contacted me via private message, sponsoring me weekly to continue developing arbitrage programs (and sharing the code for him to use).
âœ… February 2025: Received a part-time job writing some simple crypto bots.
Among them, the income from IPO and arbitrage is unstable, but the "fixed salary" from sponsorship + part-time work is about 20,000+ per month.

chunks.en:
ğŸ’¡ Projects tried in the past few months, focusing on "fast development, fast launch, fast trial and error, fast next":

- Script to automatically mint Bitcoin Runes
- Image processing website
- Edited a few videos
- Script to batch stake Cosmos
- Twitter bot
- Bot to increase Sui transaction volume / number of transaction users
- And a few "useless" websites ğŸ˜‚
- Etc...

ğŸ“Œ Current situation:
Comfortably at home, full-time "free development" (although the income is still not stable enough).

ğŸš€ Future:
Continue to work hard and strive to retire early.
Short-term expectations: Find an arbitrage / Rust "real-world" development partner to share some of the workload!
I quit my job at the end of August 2024, played around for a few months, and was confused for a while.
I started trying freelancing, independent development, personal IP, etc. in November.
I am still working hard to monetize, and I don't know how long I can stick with this path. I have set myself a deadline of 2 years. Keep it up!

@glacer Find a meme launch platform similar to "pump.fun", then receive the news of a successful launch ğŸš€, automatically buy in, and then sell according to your own logic. I have statistics on December and January data, and the probability of making money is over 80%.
I saw the poster say they are going on blind dates. If I were a girl, I would never consider it... Nowadays, girls have high requirements for stability.
Amazing, I also started farming airdrops around October last year, but I went astray and made a bunch of TG games that don't make any money at all.
Awesome, bro!
Aren't you worried about being sensitive doing these things on the screen in a domestic library?

I'm getting old and haven't found a partner yet (going on blind dates). I'll see how the blind dates go and then consider where to go.
Big shot, I'm very curious how you made 20k... I can do both front-end and back-end, please take me with you!
Same programmer, I usually make 10k+ a month doing crypto trading.

Amazing, same here, unemployed for a year and completely lying flat...
I'm currently doing the nodepay airdrop, and I already have 100+ accounts.

Also in Hangzhou, if you have time, we can meet offline, learn from you, and give you some suggestions.

Also left my job in January 2024 and haven't looked for a job since. I specialize in making blockchain tools to trade coins and earn some money. Not as diligent as the poster, I rest after making some money.
